page.title: 05COUNCIL BUILDING
page.content: In the centre of the village is a {council estate}of houses and flats.The first houses were built after the 1939-45 war. A stone plaque{dated 1949 was inserted in the front of the first pair of{semi-detached houses}to be completed. The houses were on three sides of a large village green. Early in the 1960s{three blocks of {flats}were built to the west of the council houses. The flats house a total of 80 families but provide only {2-bedroomed accommodation.}This has contributed to a transitory population as families tend to move as soon as children begin to grow up, needing more bedrooms. {Prefabricated houses}were erected just after the war to provide cheap quickly-built housing to last ten years. In 1975 they were demolished to make way for{new terraced houses.
